conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the V-shaped wire in a magnetic field.
The wire is bent into a V-shape with two equal segments, each of length l, and the angle between the segments is 60 degrees.
The magnetic force on each segment is calculated using F = BIl sin(theta), with theta = 90 degrees.
The magnitude of the force on each segment is F = BIl.
Resolve the forces into components due to the 60-degree angle between segments.
The vertical components of the forces cancel out, and the horizontal components add up.
Calculate the horizontal component for each segment as F cos 30 degrees = BIl cos 30 degrees.
The total horizontal force is 2(BIl cos 30 degrees) = sqrt(3)BIl.
The magnitude of the total Ampere force is sqrt(3)BIl.
